alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley; Harper; Harvey; Kingman; Reno; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 06 at 2:22AM CDT until July 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values of 105 to 110. * WHERE...Reno, Harvey, Butler, Kingman, Sedgwick, Harper, Sumner and Cowley Counties. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 8 PM this evening to 8 PM CDT Thursday. For the Heat Advisory, until 8 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Stay well hydrated to reduce the risk of heat related illnesses. Avoid working outside during between 1 PM and 7 PM if possible.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Cowley; Harper; Harvey; Kingman; Reno; Sedgwick; Sumner
